unjoin
  • Reference
  • News

Split a table in two and remove repeated values.

This is a subset of the tasks done by nest.

unjoin(data, ...)

# S3 method for unjoin
unjoin(data, ..., key_col = ".idx0")

# S3 method for data.frame
unjoin(data, ..., key_col = ".idx0")

Arguments

data
A data frame.
...
Specification of columns to nest. Use bare variable names. Select all variables between x and z with x:z, exclude y with -y. For more options, see the select documentation.
key_col
The name of the new column to key the two output data frames.

See also

`dplyr::inner_join` for the inverse operation.

`tidyr::nest` for the complementary operation resulting in one data frame

Examples

library(dplyr)
data("Seatbelts", package= "datasets")
x <- unjoin(as.data.frame(Seatbelts), front, rear, kms)
all.equal(inner_join(x$.idx0, x$data) %>% select(-.idx0), as.data.frame(Seatbelts))
#> Joining, by = ".idx0"
#> [1] TRUE

iris %>% unjoin(-Species)
#> $.idx0
#> # A tibble: 149 × 5
#>    Sepal.Length Sepal.Width Petal.Length Petal.Width .idx0
#>           <dbl>       <dbl>        <dbl>       <dbl> <int>

#> 2           4.9         3.0          1.4         0.2    19
#> 3           4.7         3.2          1.3         0.2    10

#> 5           5.0         3.6          1.4         0.2    32
#> 6           5.4         3.9          1.7         0.4    52
#> 7           4.6         3.4          1.4         0.3     8
#> 8           5.0         3.4          1.5         0.2    28
#> 9           4.4         2.9          1.4         0.2     2
#> 10          4.9         3.1          1.5         0.1    20

#> [1] "unjoin"

if (require("gapminder")) {
  gapminder %>%
    group_by(country, continent) %>%
    unjoin()

  gapminder %>%
    unjoin(-country, -continent)
  unjoin(gapminder)
}
#> $.idx0
#> # A tibble: 1 × 1
#>   .idx0
#>   <int>
#> 1     1
